required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.official_title: A Randomized, Multicenter, Double-Blind, Parallel, Placebo-Controlled Study of the Effects of JNJ-28431754 on Cardiovascular Outcomes in Adult Subjects With Type 2 Diabetes Mellitus

collaborator.agency: The George Institute for Global Health, Australia

brief_summary.textblock:
The study will assess canagliflozin (JNJ-28431754) in the treatment of patients with type 2 diabetes mellitus (T2DM) with regard to cardiovascular (CV) risk for major adverse cardiac events (MACE). Other objectives include evaluating the overall safety, tolerability, and effectiveness of canagliflozin.
The data from this study will be combined with the data from CANVAS-R study (Study of the Effects of Canagliflozin on Renal Endpoints in Adult Subjects with T2DM, NCT01989754) in a pre-specified integrated analysis of CV safety outcomes to satisfy US FDA post-marketing requirements for canagliflozin.

detailed_description.textblock: The study will evaluate canagliflozin compared to placebo on CV events including CV death, heart attack, and stroke in patients with T2DM, whose diabetes is not well controlled at the beginning of the study and who have a history of CV events or have a high risk for CV events. The study includes 3 substudies which will compare the effectiveness of lowering blood glucose and assess the safety of canagliflozin relative to placebo in patients receiving specific commonly-used diabetes agents. 4,330 participants will be randomly assigned to treatment with 1 of 2 doses of canagliflozin (100 or 300 mg) or placebo, in a 1:1:1 ratio. This study was originally designed to last for up to 9 years. As per FDA post-marketing requirements for canagliflozin, the study's last subject last visit will now occur when enough MACE events (ie, CV death, nonfatal myocardial infarction, nonfatal stroke) are accumulated between the CANVAS (this study) and CANVAS-R studies. The completion target was reached in February 2017.

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.measure: Time to First Occurrence of Major Adverse Cardiovascular Events, Including CV Death, Nonfatal Myocardial Infarction (MI), and Nonfatal Stroke
primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, time to event up to end of study (approximately 8 years)

secondary_outcome.measure: A Standard Masure of Fasting Insulin Secretion
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline up to end of study (approximately 8 years)

secondary_outcome.measure: Time to First Occurrence of Progression of Albumin in the Urine
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, time to event up to end of study (approximately 8 years)

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Urinary Albumin/Creatinine Ratio From Baseline at End of Treatment
Change in Estimated Glomerular Filtration Rate (eGFR) From Baseline at End of Treatment
Change in Glycated Hemoglobin (HbA1c) From Baseline at Week 18 and End of Treatment
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, Week 18, and end of treatment (approximately 369 weeks)

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Fasting Plasma Glucose (FPG) From Baseline at Week 18 and End of Treatment
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, Week 18, and end of treatment (approximately 369 weeks)

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Body Weight From Baseline at Week 18 and End of Treatment
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, Week 18, and end of treatment (approximately 369 weeks)

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Systolic Blood Pressure From Baseline at Week 18and End of Treatment
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, Week 18, and end of treatment (approximately 369 weeks)

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Diastolic Blood Pressure From Baseline at Week 18 and End of Treatment
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, Week 18, and end of treatment (approximately 369 weeks)

secondary_outcome.measure: Percent Change in Fasting Plasma Lipid Levels From Baseline at Week 18 and End of Treatment
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, Week 18, and end of treatment (approximately 369 weeks)
secondary_outcome.description: Fasting plasma lipids included triglycerides, high-density lipoprotein-cholesterol [HDL-C], low-density lipoprotein-cholesterol [LDL-C], and total cholesterol.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percent Change in Low-Density Lipoprotein-Cholesterol (LDL-C) to High-Density Lipoprotein-Cholesterol (HDL-C) Ratio From Baseline at Week 18 and End of Treatment
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, Week 18, and end of treatment (approximately 369 weeks)

secondary_outcome.measure: Effectiveness of Lowering Blood Glucose (in Substudies of Patients who are Also Taking Specific Commonly-Used Diabetes Agents)

arm_group.description: Each patient will receive placebo (inactive medication) on background standard of care for diabetes once daily for the duration of the study
Each patient will receive canagliflozin (JNJ-28431754) 100 mg once daily on background standard of care for diabetes once daily for the duration of the study
Each patient will receive canagliflozin (JNJ-28431754) 300 mg once daily on background standard of care for diabetes once daily for the duration of the study

intervention.description: One placebo capsule taken orally (by mouth) once daily
One 100 mg capsule taken orally (by mouth) once daily
One 300 mg capsule taken orally (by mouth) once daily

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patients must have a diagnosis of type 2 diabetes mellitus and greater than or equal to (>=) 30 yrs old with history of cardiovascular (CV) event, or >= 50 yrs old with high risk of CV events
- Patients must have inadequate diabetes control (as defined by glycosylated hemoglobin greater than or equal to 7.0% to less than or equal to 10.5% at screening) and be either (1) not currently on diabetes drug therapy or (2) on therapy with any approved class of diabetes drugs
Exclusion Criteria:
- A history of diabetic ketoacidosis, type 1 diabetes mellitus, pancreas or beta-cell transplantation, or diabetes secondary to pancreatitis or pancreatectomy
- History of one or more severe hypoglycemic (ie, very low blood sugar) episode within 6 months before screening

overall_official.last_name: Janssen Research & Development, LLC Clinical Trial
